artists.name: Atelier Luxus
artists.description: Atelier Luxus is leading in the realm of luxury switches, crafting exquisite, hand-finished products that seamlessly integrate the latest technological advancements. Infused with unique details, solid precious metals, and unparalleled craftsmanship, Atelier Luxus’ products redefine quality both aesthetically and materially. These exceptional pieces boast finishings of unparalleled finesse and a richness of tones. Each piece is meticulously crafted from a single sheet of thick, pure brass, providing almost limitless possibilities for various patinas. Atelier Luxus is represented by Legio Architechtural Solutions, a Copenhagen based architectural firm specialised in lighting, light planning and bespoke interior.

artists.name: ÁBBATTE
artists.description: The mission and calling of Ábbatte is to use manual looms to create lovely textile objects that become part of our lives, transform usefulness into beauty, and leave their mark on our souls—fabrics that closely intertwine an aesthetic perception and a philosophy of life. These exquisitely refined fabrics are pure and genuine beauty, eschewing all ornamentation. They are warm, sophisticated, and restrained. Ábbatte creates these fabrics to be pleasant to the sight as well as to the touch. They envelop us and become our second skin by developing our sense of touch—the most atavistic of the senses—which has an enormous impact on our sensitivity.

artists.name: Form & Refine
artists.description: Form & Refine is a Danish design brand that celebrates materials, form and sustainability equally. The pure materials are carefully selected from around the world and skilfully crafted locally using time-honored traditions. They see design as an artistic expression but equally as a functional object that never compromises on quality.

artists.name: MatzForm Scandinavia
artists.description: MatzForm is simplicity and quality. It is the embodiment of furniture that you will always treasure, and always use. MatzForm does not make intellectually interesting design conceits only built to impress for one show, or one season. MatzForm furniture is timeless, durable, and eminently functional. There are no fashionable pieces in the MatzForm catalogue, because fashion changes every year. Each item manufactured by MatzForm is a licensed design chosen because it transcends fashion with the timelessly elegant confluence of form and function. Classic Scandinavian design under license from designers such as: Verner Panton, Ib Kofod-Larsen, Erling Torvits, Ejvind Johansson, H. W. Klein, Arne Hovmand-Olsen and Thomas E. Alken.

artists.name: Karup Design
artists.description: Karup Design stands out in the furniture industry for its multifunctional and stylish furniture. Emphasizing the philosophy 'Make room for more. In less space,' Karup Design's focus has always been on functional yet aesthetically pleasing furniture solutions. This focus on multifunctionality is not merely about utility but also a commitment to decluttering and simplifying living areas. Aesthetically, Karup Design’s creations embrace a minimalist ethos, characterized by clean lines, simplicity, and a natural color scheme, primarily using pine wood and complimentary color tones. This design approach extends beyond visual appeal, fostering a sense of openness and more space, especially in small living spaces.

artists.name: RÄKKI RUGS
artists.description: Established in Berlin in 2022, RÄKKI RUGS creates a distinctive range of high-quality, hand-knotted rugs from Nepal that centre timeless design, traditional handicraft with the inspiration of contemporary art and culture. Characterized by subtle and lively polychromy, unique design and great love for detail. RÄKKI RUGS is woven exclusively from natural fibers and is committed to creating rugs that last and grow in beauty over time. Rebekka Stange is the founder and designer of RÄKKI RUGS. In the design process, her creative search repeatedly encounters the fascination of the unfinished, the provisional and the possible. RÄKKI RUGS is available globally online and through a handful of carefully selected retail partners in Germany.

artists.name: Daydreaming objects
artists.description: Daydreaming Objects is represented by a Copenhagen-based creative duo: lighting designer Ruta Palionyte and architect Leva Baranauskaite. Combining diverse skills, the duo creates lighting design objects that go beyond mere function, telling stories and infusing everyday spaces with dreaminess. They approach a blend of unexpected materials, curiosity-driven research, and bold experimentation, pushing the boundaries of creativity in lighting design. In 2024, the creative studio Daydreaming Objects is launching their new lighting series, Soft Solids. The Soft Solids explore the intentional use and repurposing of natural material—wax, reflecting on its potential for regeneration within design practice.

artists.name: Serax
artists.description: Serax is more than a brand. Based in Belgium but with a global reach and outlook, Serax creates contemporary homeware in collaboration with leading international designers and makers, bound together by a shared vision of elevating everyday spaces elevating spaces. Every Serax object is a balance of aesthetics and function. From the smallest to the largest, each one becomes a treasured object that can last for generations: a work of art in its own right. Designed in Europe – manufactured all over the world.

artists.name: V-ZUG
artists.description: V-ZUG , Switzerland’s leading brand for household appliances, has been developing and producing kitchen and laundry appliances in Switzerland for 111 years and providing comprehensive service in all its markets. At V Z UG, we believe that time is of essence. And each one of us should focus on what matters: sharing, hosting, living. A company rooted in Switzerland since 1913, we are committed to building a sustainable future through the manufacturing of long lasting appliances and responsible, carbon neutral production. We work hard every day to bring simplicity to your home and creativity to your kitchen.

artists.name: Cph Lighting
artists.description: Timeless Design Made To Last. Cph Lighting is a Danish lighting brand under the current ownership since 2007. Their mission is to create lighting that will stay relevant and appreciated, both functionally and visually, for many years to come, and hopefully for generations. The Cph Lighting collection includes classic and contemporary lighting objects by acclaimed designers. Demanded for private and commercial interiors. Their lighting is made with focus on long-lasting quality, great functionality, the good light, and low energy consumption. All wrapped in beautiful and timeless design. The Cph Lighting collection is manufactured in Denmark with the use of proud traditional craftsmanship as well as modern production technology.

artists.name: KunstIndustrien
artists.description: KunstIndustrien value supreme quality, aiming for the highest standards in everything they do. Their handcrafted wax candles combine traditional craftsmanship with modern design, and they never compromise in the choices of raw materials or suppliers. KunstIndustrien is known for their exquisite quality products and for Candles you can Trust. Their wide variety of quality candles satisfy every need for an inviting and warm atmosphere for both business and pleasure. KunstIndustriens wax candles are made with RSPO certified stearin and are EN-tested and approved for low soot behavior. Their 100% upcycled olive wax candles are made from the left over-olive pulp from olive oil production. Olive trees are resourceful thru many years.

artists.name: MARTIN KECHAYAS
artists.description: Designers of today shaping the furniture of tomorrow. The mission is to produce furniture for everyone designed by living designers. Martin Kechayas design sustainable furniture for the future that are inspired by the time we live in, and for people living in our time. There is a common thread through the designs of Martin Kechayas that tells a story – a story about a development process, refinement of a consistent idea; to shape functional, organic spectacle - and yet challenging forms: As a kind of zoological form - this is how I imagines the furniture. As an organism of its own characteristic nature - this is how it calls to be created and invite the user to come closer - and use!.

artists.name: ReCollector
artists.description: ReCollector designs storage solutions for small living spaces made from recycled or certified materials. The goal is to create products that make the everyday lives of consumers easier, more convenient, and stylish. All products are developed through anthropological research to understand the preferences, needs, and everyday lives of consumers. Responsibility is ingrained in ReCollector's DNA - with regards to relations, driving business, and production where nature serves as a significant source of inspiration for ReCollector. The aim is to move away from linear thinking and instead draw inspiration from nature, where everything operates in a circular manner.

artists.name: Anker & Co
artists.description: Anker & Co represents well-known international lighting brands such as Michael Anastassiades, Wästberg and XAL. They develop and implement high-quality lighting solutions for offices, shops, hotels, restaurants, public spaces, outdoor areas and private residences in close collaboration with builders, architects and lighting designers.

artists.name: Desalto
artists.description: For over 30 years, Desalto has nurtured a concept of aesthetically sophisticated products rooted in continuous technical and technological research aimed at enhanced functionality. With three decades of activity, Desalto stands as both a youthful and time-honoured brand—a dynamic spirit that seamlessly blends iconic seating and complements, resembling graphic forms sketched in the air, with tables as versatile as daily life itself. The narrative began in 1990 when the four Orsenigo brothers, heirs to a family metalworking business, envisioned a company more attuned to contemporary trends. They sought collaboration with designers, fostering diverse perspectives that align with the same corporate philosophy centred on fundamental values of harmony and elegance.

artists.name: ARNE AKSEL x e-Types
artists.description: KARNE AKSEL aim to inspire through extraordinary textile experiences, and believe that the immediate materiality of fabrics is a catalyst of aesthetic emotional experiences. In 2017 ARNE AKSEL made it a mission to share these experiences with the world, and love to collaborate with designers, architects, and businesses in creating tailored solutions for their projects. This year ARNE AKSEL and e-Types, a Copenhagen based brand agency, teamed up. e-Types build successful brands based on sharp insights, award winning aesthetics and big ideas. e-Types believe the best solutions are the simplest ones, and the most desirable brands are the ones that ring true.

artists.name: TABLEAU
artists.description: Tableau is a multidisciplinary creative studio and exhibition space. Founded in Copenhagen in 2018 by floral designer Julius Værnes Iversen, Tableau works to deconstruct established ideas of art and design through a collaborative approach. Alongside the exhibition space and concept store, Tableau offers floral design, object design, set design, interior design, and architectural installations. The approach is to source collaborators globally to break down barriers between art and design. Past work includes projects for Hermes, Tom Dixon, Vogue, among others.

artists.name: Ege Carpets
artists.description: Weaving together timeless Danish design and sustainable ambitions, Ege Carpets craft wall-to-wall carpets, rugs, carpet tiles and planks for commercial buildings, hotels, cruise ships, art galleries, exhibitions and more. Offering an attractive selection of pick-and-produce designs as well as endless custom design opportunities, Ege Carpets are chosen by high-profile companies all over the world. Explore the new and extensive rugs concept featuring amazing collaborations with renowned designers including Tom Dixon, Monsieur Christian Lacroix, Nicolette Brunklaus, Laura Bilde and Linnea Blæhr.

artists.name: FROST Denmark
artists.description: FROST was founded on June 1st, 2002 by Hans Jørgen Frost. The story began with a vision of creating a new generation of interior design accessories and architectural hardware where the Danish design tradition and functionality go hand in hand. Over the past 20 years, FROST has grown into something unimagined. Proudly joining the inner circle of established design companies, FROST now dares to dream of becoming the market leader. Working tirelessly every day, consistently providing timeless designs to compliment the consumers lifestyle and enhance the feel-good factor in their life.

artists.name: Hemverk
artists.description: Scandinavian simplicity. Hemverk is a collection of wall clocks that unite form and function with their minimalist Scandinavian style and simplicity. The design is clean, simple and elegant, the better to highlight the most important function of the clock: to tell the time. After all, time is the most important feature. All the clocks are produced and assembled by hand in a small workshop in Denmark, with great attention to detail. Every clock is made uniquely for each order, which ensures a responsible production process and avoiding overproduction. Their minimalist design gives our clocks a distinct character and there are many options for both clock hands and clock faces, combining colours and materials based on personal preferences.

artists.name: Wästberg
artists.description: In close collaboration with leading architects and designers, Wästberg creates long-lasting, technologically driven, economically viable and environmentally conscious lighting. Lighting that answers to fundamental human needs, both physical and emotional, and adapts to these needs as they evolve and shift.

artists.name: Fiorini Trading
artists.description: Fiorini Trading represents well-known international furniture brands such as Living Divani, Extremis, Desalto, Gebrüder Thonet Vienna, Alias, Asplund, and Ondarreta. All of Fiorini Trading’s brands are family-owned companies run through several generations with proud traditions in quality craftsmanship, own production and with collections created by world-leading designers.

artists.name: Sheyn
artists.description: For his brand named Sheyn, Vienna-based designer Nicolas Gold has created a range of intricately patterned homeware called Tiny Architecture that is made using 3D printing techniques. Gold trained with Zaha Hadid before founding Sheyn in 2016 with partner Markus Schaffer to focus on creating what they term Tiny Architecture — homeware made with an architect's predilection for fussing over the tiniest details of furniture and fixtures. The collection includes vases, bowls, planters and lighting, all made from a light, sturdy, and recyclable corn-based compound. Every design is 3D printed on demand at Sheyn's studio in the heart of Vienna.

artists.name: Plastiz
artists.description: Plastiz transforms plastic waste into a new surface material 100% recycled and recyclable for visionary designers and architects. Its mission is to respond to the environmental emergency caused by the invasion of plastic waste while delivering a valuable alternative to the use of virgin plastic and other non-sustainable or extractive materials in design and architectural projects. Each panel tells a story of recycling and beauty, giving a new life to soap bottles, caps, spools, coffee capsules and more, preventing this precious material from being burnt or ending up in landfills. With more than 30 textures in solid and translucent materials, Plastiz panels come in big size and various thicknesses to adapt to countless applications.

artists.name: WOUD
artists.description: WOUD is a Danish design brand founded with the vision of establishing a harmonious collective that blends the talents of innovative newcomers and experienced designers. With a broad and deep selection of refined furniture, home accessories and lighting designs, WOUD creates timeless pieces that are made for you - and made for use. Deeply anchored in the Scandinavian design heritage and enriched by creative perspectives from around the world, the collection draws inspiration from the clean lines of modern architecture and the serene, soothing hues found in nature. Embodying the essence of elegant simplicity, longevity and honest craftsmanship.

artists.name: Wabi Sabi Nordic
artists.description: Wabi Sabi Nordic is a Danish interior brand specializing in natural stone. With a simple and stringent design language, they let the material speak and be the defining element, both aesthetically and functionally. The brand was founded in 2020 by Stine Rosgaard, and today it offers a wide range of objects and furniture, all exclusively made from natural stone. Stone as a material has its limitations but also clear advantages, which have been a core aspect for the brand from day one. Beautiful and functional interior in stone, where the material is treated with care and respect, and where the purpose is to create products that endure for generations.

artists.name: Linie Design
artists.description: Established in 1980 with the mission of creating quality, Danish-designed rugs, Linie Design is now one of the largest developers of handmade rugs in Europe and sold in over 70 countries worldwide, including its own brand store in Copenhagen. Originally built on collaborations with influential female weavers, today the talented team of designers is led by Urd Moll Gundermann as Head of Design, with all designs handmade in India by artisan craftsmen using time-honoured weaving and knotting techniques.All rugs are made with natural, certified materials where possible, complying with relevant European legislation and global associations that protect the environment and enable responsible sourcing, careful monitoring and transparent production.

artists.name: VERPAN
artists.description: VERPAN – for Verner Panton – is a design company working to preserve, reissue and recontextualise the Danish architect and designer’s radiant body of work – from minute objects to immersive environments. Verner Panton’s lighting, furniture and objects is testament to a playful and unconventional spirit, spanning his most celebrated work and recently unearthed archival pieces. VERPAN is proud to continuously build on the contemporary legacy of Verner Panton. Assembled with utmost care and craft, VERPAN’s collection brings an unparalleled heritage into a new era of life, work and interaction.

artists.name: Petite Friture
artists.description: Petite Friture has made a name for itself as a design editor like no other, a universe to live in with a wholly independent style and tone. Now available in more than 70 countries, the independent French company has become more international with over 60 designers to its name and continues to push boldly forward to unearth new talents and to nurture a project with purpose. Petite Friture is proud to take a stand, seeking out the best solutions at every step of the way, using the right techniques and right people to better serve the planet and do something good. Petite Friture is more than just a design editor, it is a state of mind grounded in trust and optimism. Its ambition: contribute, through its collection to making good out of beauty.

artists.name: Wendelbo
artists.description: Starting as a small family workshop specialising in upholstery, the foundation stones of Wendelbo were laid in 1955. Six decades and three generations later, the story of the Danish family with a strong dedication to design continues to unfold and prosper. Today, Wendelbo is an international design company fusing uncompromising upholstery and complementing design icons. Forming long-lasting collaborations with international designers, their collection bridges skilled craftsmanship, supreme quality, and a sophisticated international design signature.

artists.name: RUE VERTE
artists.description: RUE VERTE is a multi–brand boutique. The space is filled with a carefully curated selection of unique objects, vintage finds and art pieces mixed with high–end furnishings by some of the world’s foremost designers.

artists.name: Silkeborg Uldspinderi
artists.description: Silkeborg Uldspinderi is a third-generation design company based on decades of know-how dating as far back as 1947. Grown from the passion for raw wool and alpaca materials, craftsmanship and design, Silkeborg Uldspinderi proudly presents its stunning collection of exclusive, long-lasting throws, cushions, and scarfs – weaved for today in collaboration with textile designers Karin Carlander, Margrethe Odgaard, Stilleben and Tina Ratzer. Silkeborg Uldspinderi handpicks and carefully processes every single material sourced with respect for the animals, the farmers, and our planet, and is honored to be certified by the RWS. Feel the passion in every product, every design, and every thread with Silkeborg Uldspinderi.

artists.name: ateljé Lyktan
artists.description: At the end of the vast flat lands of southern Sweden, at the edge of the Baltic Sea, lies the small town of Åhus. This is the setting for ateljé Lyktan, a lighting manufacturer with an 90-year long history and an archive of lights that have defined Swedish design over the last century. By creating innovative, energy efficient and sustainable lighting solutions adapted to people’s requirements and with the least possible impact on the environment, ateljé Lyktan contributes to, and takes responsibility for, a sustainable development within society in general.

artists.name: Ambientec
artists.description: Ambientec, a Japanese light design company founded in 2009, envisions creating portable, indestructible lights with integrated LED technology, maintaining comfort and elegance. This philosophy is evident in its designs, each embracing a poetic quality of light that engages in a friendly dialogue with the illuminated space. Even turned off, Ambientec lights add beauty to any environment. Originally specializing in protective underwater cases for professional photography equipment, Ambientec's roots contributed expertise in creating portable gear resistant to extreme conditions. This background led to its venture into portable lamp design, exploring new frontiers in lighting for everyday spaces, indoors and outdoors.

artists.name: Andersen Furniture
artists.description: Andersen Furniture is a design company with an approach rooted in curiosity, innovation, and talent for the benefit of everyone. The company strives to create unique designs with a focus on a long-life cycle, developing contract furniture in close collaboration with talented architects and designers. This collaboration aims to challenge form, function, and material, resulting in furniture designed to last for generations. With passion, Andersen Furniture designs contract furniture that combines functionality and character, featuring a clean and modern expression. The collection reflects the Scandinavian history of craftsmanship while challenging contemporary forms, offering professional and contemporary furniture for various spaces.

artists.name: Ukurant
artists.description: Ukurant celebrates experimental approaches to craft, material and tradition, offering young designers a platform and spotlight to present their work and push the boundaries of the established design scene. Whether it is in unconventional ways or in tribute to past generations, Ukurant presents new perspectives in the world of design and showcases prospective design by emerging talents.

artists.name: Artemide
artists.description: Artemide is one of the most known illumination brands in the world. Known for its The Human Light philosophy, Artemide boasts high skills in light design and innovation, with products originating from research and high-quality manufacturing.

artists.name: Man of Parts
artists.description: Born of a cross cultural, post-national design sensibility, MAN OF PARTS was created for global nomads who appreciate craft but prefer a modern experience.

artists.name: Jacob Jensen
artists.description: Jacob Jensen is a realm of Danish design, transforming everyday essentials into extraordinary objects that captivate, bringing surprise, delight, and meaningful impact. Since its beginnings in 1958, Jacob Jensen's design philosophy has given rise to pioneering products and design decisions that have left an indelible mark globally. Today, Jacob Jensen continues to shape dynamic and distinctive designs, grounded in Danish simplicity and, more crucially, the needs of the people who will use these products. Then, as now, the paramount objective is an unwavering commitment to enhancing the daily lives of everyone.

artists.name: Paustian
artists.description: Paustian is a Danish furniture and design house with an international outlook. Since 1964, Paustian has represented some of the most celebrated and renowned furniture designs, supplying furniture and interior solutions for both homes and organizations. Furthermore, Paustian has its own collection - Paustian Furniture Collection - that includes Danish design icons such as the Paustian Modular Sofa designed by Erik Rasmussen in 1969, and the Arctander Chair designed by Phillip Arctander in 1944.

artists.name: FABRIC FOREST
artists.description: Fabric Forest offers thoughtful interior design products for a sustainable future. They have used a new and innovative technique to develop a renewable textile material from Swedish trees, which gives the opportunity to transform the entire textile industry.

artists.name: Tine K Home
artists.description: Tine K Home creates interior and furniture with Scandinavian simplicity in mind and has always believed in authentic living. Beautiful items are ever inspiring. Tine K Home is drawn to natural shades and honest materials. They perfectly blend in, and the different textures will complement each other and provide a harmonious contrast to treasured accessories and family heirlooms. This is forever the essence of timeless furniture and interior design.

artists.name: TAKT
artists.description: TAKT is rethinking the approach to designing, constructing, and selling furniture, aiming to bring high-quality design to a broader audience. The brand is challenging the prevailing throw-away culture around furniture, asserting that furniture is not disposable. Furniture should be loved, cared for and handed to future generations. Therefore, all TAKT furniture is designed for repair. Their component based approach to design means that all parts are replaceable, so when life happens, you’ll be able to identify the right part of the furniture to repair or replace. This way, your furniture could last forever. Furthermore, TAKT is a B Corp and all products are certified with the EU Ecolabel. TAKT calls it 'Perpetual Sustainable Design'.

artists.name: FRAMING
artists.description: JFRAMING provides the framework for a variety of curated content with the aim to promote design, nationally as well as internationally. During 3daysofdesign, FRAMING will create a joint exhibition at a spectacular venue showcasing exclusive design brands and their novelties in an inspiring and relevant way. The current set design ensures a visual flow throughout the exhibition by presenting all new designs with an eye for the aesthetics. FRAMING offers a platform for creative collaborations within the design, interior and lifestyle industries.

artists.name: Cane-line
artists.description: Cane-line is a Danish design company with more than 35 years of experience in designing and manufacturing functional and comfortable furniture. Life made comfortable is the very essence of Cane-line. All over the world the mission is the same - to make life comfortable and add value to life and the places you unwind and relax. Cane-line focus on quality and innovative technologies to create designs that will bring you joy today and in the future. Cane-line designs are made with the greatest care for the environment and the well-being of people.

artists.name: Danish Architecture Center
artists.description: JDanish Architecture Center (DAC) is an international cultural attraction for everyone who wants to experience and understand how architecture and design create the framework for our lives. DAC is located in the heart of Copenhagen in the spectacular BLOX building which is situated right at the harbor front and as part of Copenhagen’s Cultural Quarter. Through exhibitions, tours, events, learning and networking, Danish Architecture Center creates space for inspiration, enjoyment and immersion.

artists.name: blomus
artists.description: Since its establishment in 1961, blomus has been a pivotal player in the interior design and accessories industry, specialising in intelligent, minimalist, and functional design for the contemporary home. Rooted in the German tradition of exceptional quality and highly skilled craftsmanship, blomus has achieved international recognition for its commitment to the honesty of materials, the purity of shape, and a passionate approach to design. The brand is based in Sundern (D) and maintains a creative hub in Copenhagen (DK), fostering collaboration with partners worldwide. blomus proudly considers itself an international company with a global market reach. Driven by passion and operated as a family business, blomus is dedicated to providing designs that endure and are cherished for generations to come.

artists.name: Eva Solo
artists.description: At Eva Solo, the team never sits still, tirelessly exploring new possibilities to infuse elegance, function, and design into people's homes, enriching their everyday lives. The Furniture Collection marks an expansion of their product line from kitchen and dining areas to equally exciting living spaces. Designed to be both simple and bold, charismatic and understated, each piece in the Furniture Collection is a modern classic that enhances any room it graces, regardless of its placement.

artists.name: Tekla
artists.description: JEstablished in Copenhagen in 2017, Tekla creates elevated yet functional homeware pieces that centre a timeless, straightforward design expression. Since launching, Tekla has embodied an honest commitment to uncompromising quality. With a foundation in bedding, the full collection now comprises pieces for the entire home, including towels, sleepwear and kitchen linens – all made to be lived in and made to last. Tekla holds B Corp certification, joining a global movement of people using business as a force for good. Tekla is available at its Copenhagen store, globally online and through a handful of carefully selected retail partners in Europe, North America and the Asia-Pacific.

artists.name: Ekbacken Studios
artists.description: Ekbacken Studios is a design studio founded in 2022 in Stockholm, Sweden by a Scandinavian team united in a passion for design and sustainability with a mission to redefine luxury and the way we consume. Dedicated to pushing the boundaries of artistic expression through the upcycling of waste materials in combination with innovative production methods in the form of 3D-printing, their furniture is both durable and luxurious, contributing to a lower climate impact. The award winning design studio is renowned for its commitment to creativity, quality, and environmental responsibility.

artists.name: EST.18
artists.description: JEST 18, based in the cultural heart of Copenhagen at Kanonbådsvej 4A, is a brand that embodies the spirit of innovation and timeless design. Founded on the principles of sustainability, craftsmanship, and traditions, EST 18 curates and showcases exceptional pieces from global artisans and designers. Representing a carefully selected group of brands, EST 18 is a conduit for enduring design, offering objects that harmonize artisan techniques with contemporary relevance. Welcome to a world where every piece narrates a journey of creativity, sustainability, and timeless appeal.

artists.name: Plauborg Furniture
artists.description: JCustomized furniture that suit your unique needs and preferences. Designed and produced in Denmark.

artists.name: Carpe Diem Beds
artists.description: JUnwind in bespoke luxury with Carpe Diem Beds: Harmoniously blending comfort, innovation and Scandinavian design. Inspired by serene cliffs, vast ocean, and fields of heather on the West Coast of Sweden, each bed is meticulously created to transport you to a haven of tranquility. Carpe Diem Beds are handmade in Sweden with carefully chosen materials such as solid Nordic pine, organic cotton, Talalay latex and luxurious fabrics. All beds are customizable to reflect your taste and needs with a wide range of headboards, bed legs and functions. Carpe Diem Beds creates beds that please the eye as much as the body by transcending functionality to become a testament of style and comfort.

artists.name: All Matters Studio
artists.description: All Matters Studio is a Stockholm-based design studio founded in 2020. Their mission is to create and produce timeless and high quality interior products developed from a Scandinavian design mindset with an International approach. Recognizing the significance of incorporating scent into interior design, All Matters Studio joined forces with Emmanuel Martini, a distinguished French Perfume Designer, and introduced their independent fragrance brand En Doft™ at 3daysofdesign in 2022. Subsequently, they have unveiled a collection of exquisite, artisanal Room Perfumes, enriching the extra dimension of design.

artists.name: Wood Zone
artists.description: Wood Zone is a Danish furniture design and manufacturing company. The brand is focused around high quality furniture and home decor items in solid wood - mainly oak and walnut. The product selection involves dining tables, coffee tables, bed frames, benches, chairs, lamps etc. All production takes place in Wood Zone's own carpentry in Northern Jutland. Production is another central part of the Wood Zone brand. All furniture is made with love for the traditional Danish craftsmanship traditions, however, with a modern touch. This is Wood Zone's way of ensuring long lasting furniture in timeless designs that can be passed down in generations.

artists.name: Santa & Cole
artists.description: Santa & Cole, a small, independent, global editor of design, art, and books rooted in Belloch (Barcelona), with the mission of preparing original ideas or works for the public domain. Products are meticulously designed to stand the test of time, drawing on their shape, technical solutions, and carefully chosen materials. The guiding principle is quality over quantity, with an emphasis on choosing rather than accumulating. This commitment to a material culture has been upheld for over 35 years, with the goal of extending the lifecycle of products for generations to come.

artists.name: David Design
artists.description: David Design embraces individuality and rejects conformity. They challenge the status quo, striving for something beyond the ordinary. Refusing to compromise for over 30 years, they stand firm on that commitment. Founded in 1988 by former pop star and DJ David Carlson in Malmö, David Design emerged during a time when Scandinavian design was undergoing a second wave of global attention. The brand played a vital role in revitalising the spirit of Scandinavian design with a fresh and modern approach. Years later, David Design remains true to its vision. Today, it stands as a well-established international brand, attracting followers seeking iconic, functional, and sustainable furniture and accessories.

artists.name: Kaufmann Keramik
artists.description: Kaufmann Keramik is a family-run, dedicated ceramic manufacturer from Bavaria. Authentically crafted by hand in collaboration with renowned designers, the company creates high-quality, unique ceramic pieces with a lot of heart, flair and enthusiasm for this fascinating material. Stove tiles, wall cladding, room dividers and objects whose diversity and individuality cannot be reproduced by any machine in the world, giving rooms a very special aura and charisma. Each ceramic is a handmade promise of quality for people who care about where and by whom their ceramics are produced.

artists.name: Kristina Dam Studio
artists.description: Kristina Dam Studio defines sculptural minimalism by merging the artist's meticulous attention to detail with the architect's vision and spatial understanding. The 2024 Collection ‘Journeys’ embodies a refined and distilled aesthetic, grounded in an exploration of form and material. Steel, increasingly favoured in the heart of Kristina Dam, brings beauty and strength, ensuring enduring quality for the pieces. The focus is on crafting items that are not just visually captivating but also highly functional, blending industrial intention with minimalist refinement. Kristina Dam Studio’s passion for diligent craftsmanship is evident in every item, and each design is more than just an interior object – it adds a statement to any room.

artists.name: LYFA
artists.description: LYFA is a visionary home of iconic classics from some of Denmark’s most influential lighting designers. Their enduring designs explore and enhance good lighting in all its facets and shapes. The LYFA collection is founded on pure aesthetics and a purposeful design philosophy shaped by decades of dedicated craftsmanship and captivating lighting designs. The design classics are crafted to impeccable quality standards and offer light arrangements for every home, occasion and situation.

artists.name: LE KLINT
artists.description: Le Klint’s origins date back to the beginning of the 20th century, when architect and civil engineer P.V. Jensen-Klint folded the first hand-pleated lampshade for a kerosene lamp that he had designed. Since the establishment of Le Klint in 1943, the design company has focused on excellent craftsmanship and on retaining production in Odense. Over the years, the Le Klint collection has been designed by well-known architects and new designers, and consists of traditional and modern lamps, sold all over the world.

artists.name: Enter the Salon
artists.description: Open your hearts and minds to a joint exhibition showcasing a selection of distinguished brands from around the world. Curated by designer Signe Hytte, Enter the Salon is a space where design, art and poetry converge, creating a seamless blend of the past with the present. Brought to life in a special townhouse steeped in history in the heart of Copenhagen, the exhibition is designed to provide a haven for quiet reflection, casual conversation, and the exploration of new perspectives.

artists.name: Njordrum Home
artists.description: Aesthetics is the sum of the right details. The experience of things that are made for each other and become part of a conscious context in both form and function. That the smallest detail has decisive importance for the big picture. Njordrum Home creates aesthetic, prefabricated, modular homes from wood, where beauty is considered at every stage of the design phase. It is about choosing the best materials and putting them together in a good way. Njordrum Home is also where the team behind ideate, design and develop the products they use to complete their houses. They do this to offer architecture and design where everything is connected and mutually enhance the total experience of the Njordrum Home concept.

artists.name: Artisan
artists.description: Artisan is globally renowned for its innovative furniture design and quality craftsmanship. Handmade from seven species of solid timber, Artisan pieces are produced by craftsmen in a large Bosnian factory surrounded by dense forest, the once was old school woodwork shop with a 60-year history of producing fine timber products was transformed into the modern and technologically advanced facility that it is today. Through their collections as well as individual pieces, Artisan offers a wide range of furniture such as seating, tables, sideboards, beds, lamps. The brand insists that, at the end of the production process, the furniture that adorns your living environment is as natural as the wood from which it has originated.

artists.name: more
artists.description: Designed in Hamburg, manufactured in Germany. Whether high-quality chairs, tables, beds or storage furniture, the brand has been reinterpreting modern classics since 1993. more is characterised by clear ideas, surprising features and timeless shapes - not to mention durability and sustainability. Each piece is designed and manufactured to accompany its owner for decades. Only the highest quality materials are used. These include slow-grown, certified woods, olive-based tanned leathers dyed with soluble dyes, fine woollen fabrics and ecological upholstery materials. Each collection is the result of decades of experience, yet always represents a fascinating new beginning. This will never change.

artists.name: Lintex
artists.description: You want a space of your own, a place for your thoughts, your ideas and your words. LINTEX manufactures writing boards for schools and offices but bring to this a stringency and subtlety like a well-developed fashion line. They add style and design expertise in a world in which aesthetics have, for years, taken a back seat. Whiteboards, office screens and sound absorbers have been the anonymous carthorses of schools and conference premises. LINTEX have changed all that, aiming to surprise and challenge the image of what a writing board can be.

artists.name: Juslin Maunula
artists.description: Juslin Maunula was founded by Fashion Designer Laura Juslin and Architect Lilli Maunula in 2016. Since, the fusion of fashion expertise and architectural vision has birthed a creative space that both serves as an awarded Design Studio and as the designers own distinctive Brand, breathing new life into once forgotten materials. Juslin Maunula has a unique focus: crafting designs from discarded textiles, transforming them into home products, wearables, and installations. In a world hungry for fresh thinking and mindful living, Juslin Maunula invites everyone to partake in a lifestyle where each piece tells a story of reinvention, and avant-garde style.

artists.name: Pholc
artists.description: KFounded in 2015 by Maja and Samuel Norburg, Pholc is a distinctly Swedish lighting brand with a new take on Scandinavian aesthetics. With a commitment to creating meaningful design rooted in strong ideas and long-lasting quality, Pholc takes a stand against the expected. The brand stays informed and relevant through collaboration with talents from diverse fields. A Pholc lamp possesses a characteristically unique style and personality that calls for attention and awakens curiosity.

artists.name: Peach Corner
artists.description: PEACH CORNER is an artist-run exhibition venue for Danish and international ceramics. With varying curated exhibitions and a Wunderkammer – a Cabinet of Curiosities – showing specially selected pieces, PEACH CORNER presents many different approaches to the clay and a diversity of ceramic expressions. PEACH CORNER is a dynamic forum for artistic materializations in clay and offer a platform for the full range of the ceramic field across crafts, design and visual arts.

artists.name: valerie_objects
artists.description: valerie_objects is a belgian high-end design label initiated by Axel Van Den Bossche, CEO of renowned design company Serax, and Veerle Wenes, owner of the iconic design & art gallery Valerie Traan. The mission consists of allowing extraordinary designers and artists to translate their signature style into tangible objects, in order to reinstall an aesthetic meaning to the tools and objects we use every day. In short: give daily objects their beauty back.

artists.name: TOM DIXON
artists.description: Tom Dixon, founded by the eponymous British designer Tom Dixon, stands as a global design powerhouse. Renowned for innovative creations such as the Melt pendant, Mirror Ball, and other instantly recognisable designs, the brand seamlessly blends craftsmanship and contemporary design. Its avant-garde approach to lighting, furniture and accessories has earned it a place in prestigious museums worldwide, including the V&A in London, MoMA in New York, and the Pompidou Centre in Paris. The London studio in Kings Cross serves as the epicentre of Tom Dixon's creative prowess. Embracing the ethos of innovation, honest materials, and longevity, Tom Dixon has become a global design trailblazer with an unwavering commitment to pushing boundaries.

artists.name: Cube Design
artists.description: Since the 1980s, Cube Design has been a leading player on the contract market for quality office furniture. The family-owned Danish Design Brand has a strong tradition for designing, developing, and producing modern, high-quality office furniture and creating innovative and inspiring spaces for the customers. The brand is characterized by Danish craftmanship, high quality, and durable furniture that can be used generation after generation. With a sustainable mindset Cube Design work to ensure a continued responsible furniture production. For more than 10 years, Cube Design has been ISO 14001 certified. In addition, Cube Design is FSC® certified (FSC C155594) and has a large selection of EU Ecolabel certified furniture.

artists.name: Bernstorffsminde
artists.description: Since 1837, Bernstorffsminde has been responsible for the production of quality furniture and has built a solid heritage and commitment to creating furniture that is not only beautiful, but also built to last. The company's own furniture collections BM1837 pay tribute to the timeless elegance of Danish design, which is always sought after and appreciated. Bernstorffsminde unites tradition, innovation and passion for creating furniture that is unique and beautiful in its design. Their latest collection, BM1837, is a testament to their commitment to providing quality furniture that stands the test of time and creates an atmosphere of timeless elegance.

artists.name: Mattiazzi
artists.description: In the past 12 years, Mattiazzi has emerged as a celebrated premium brand with an uncompromising design ethos, collaborating with the global design elite including: Ronan & Erwan Bouroullec, Nitzan Cohen, Konstantin Grcic, Sam Hecht & Kim Colin, Jasper Morrison, Leon Ransmeier and more. These designers approach wood production both philosophically and practically. Each collection represents strong ideas rooted in the passion of the Mattiazzi family and of their exceptional team – always optimistically embracing new technical challenges while keeping a keen eye on sustainability. By combining handmade craft and digital innovation in woodworking, Mattiazzi makes long-lasting, cherished pieces.

artists.name: by Adelborg
artists.description: by Adelborg is a furniture store filled with highly curated danish and international design. With 650m2 by Adelborg wants to push the boundaries of retail and inspire with unique colors, materials and design. At by Adelborg you will find everything from furniture, interior, original art, fashion, lightning, ceramics, even to-stay or to-go coffee - all in one spot.

artists.name: Carl Hansen & Søn
artists.description: Carl Hansen & Søn represents over 110 years of furniture history with respect and passion for quality craftsmanship. The world's largest manufacturer of furniture designed by Hans J. Wegner, Carl Hansen & Son also produces works by renowned design masters such as Kaare Klint, Poul Kjærholm, Vilhelm Lauritzen, Ole Wanscher, and Børge Mogensen. Carl Hansen & Søn furniture is produced in Denmark and sold all over the world.

artists.name: Ro Collection
artists.description: Ro Collection is a Danish design company founded in 2013 with a deep commitment to the love of craftsmanship, quality, and timeless aesthetics. In a fast and constantly changing world, Ro Collection stands as a contrast, dedicated to creating furniture and home accessories that only become more beautiful with time. Our mission is to embrace the timeless rather than the time-bound and to create products that will endure for many years to come, perhaps even appreciated across generations.

artists.name: BOLON
artists.description: RBolon is a premium design brand dedicated to thrilling the world with bold innovation for a sustainable design experience. A third-generation Swedish family company, Bolon originated with a courageous idea: crafting woven flooring from waste materials. After 75 years, the brand is driven by innovation, passion, and a profound desire to create and explore new design dimensions. Collaborating with leading international designers, architects, and fashion labels, Bolon has transformed industry fundamentals by adding design status into traditional flooring. The brand is continuously in motion, seeking to improve, surprise, and explore new dimensions of brave design.

artists.name: Kasper Kyster Design
artists.description: Kasper Kyster chases the unknown. He seeks to test his intuition and experiment with materials and principles to achieve something spontaneous. His motivation is largely about the process of creating, about producing and chasing the unique rather than the perfect. Based on topics such as statics, tectonics, form and function, he works uncompromisingly towards one concept that can become a piece of furniture or object. The limitation means that his work appears spontaneous and intuitive. Kyster puts materials and craft above everything else. He is curious about how you can experiment with old crafts to give materials new aesthetics, and how modern technologies can redefine crafts' impact on aesthetics.

artists.name: Karimoku Furniture
artists.description: Emerging from shared design values, Karimoku Case is a contemporary lifestyle brand based in Japan and born out of admiration and love for serene beauty, material richness and timeless appeal. The Karimoku Case collections are brought to life by the world’s leading architects through individual cases, and the story of each collection is told through its native setting. With Karimoku Case, Karimoku introduces its fourth high-end, contemporary furniture brand, following Karimoku New Standard, Karimoku Kunst and Ishinomaki Laboratory by Karimoku.

artists.name: Schönbuch
artists.description: RSchönbuch – a German furniture brand that stands out thanks to its clean designs, expressive colours and wide choice of finishes. As well as aesthetics, functionality and quality are fundamentally important, be it in storage systems with their endless possible variations or individual furniture items and accessories. A specialist in entrance areas, Schönbuch is now equally at home in all living and commercial spaces. The products in its portfolio are not just functional but designer pieces with exquisite craftsmanship and delicate features. Simply beautiful!

artists.name: De La Espada
artists.description: De La Espada furniture is where leading design meets the highest level of European craftsmanship. At the De La Espada atelier in Portugal, expert craftspeople specialising in solid wood and upholstery combine handcraft and advanced technology to create truly unique, meaningful objects, meticulously detailed and engineered to last a lifetime. In addition to designing in-house, De La Espada also works closely with carefully selected international design partners. The product range reflects the diversity of the collaborators as well as a shared approach to materiality, functionality, and craft.

artists.name: Midgard Licht
artists.description: Founded in 1919, Midgard Licht collection spans across unique lamps, ranging from iconic midcentury classics to radical modern drafts – meeting all requirements of design, quality and sustainability. As the inventor of adjustable lighting, Midgard aims to bring the inventiveness and bauhaus spirit into the now, striving for a balance between functionality and emotional quality of their drafts. Always touching the very heart of Midgard's philosophy - making light adjustable. Focusing on the relevance of sustainability through design, they are taking up the responsibility as a manufacturer to think in new and responsible ways about product design. Midgard produces its collection, still today, with original tools in Germany.

artists.name: TONI Copenhagen
artists.description: Founded 105 years ago, TONI Copenhagen emerged from a family's deep-rooted appreciation for traditional brass finishing and craftsmanship. Across generations, dedicated professionals have upheld this craft. In 2024, TONI Copenhagen continues to embrace these enduring values. They advocate for a simplified and personalised world, encouraging thoughtful and lasting choices for home acquisitions. Committed to creating high-quality, enduring designs, TONI Copenhagen strives to produce timeless pieces that defy fleeting trends. Objects of lasting design carry inherent stories, providing a backdrop for life's everyday moments. This has been their trade since 1918.

artists.name: Montana Furniture
artists.description: Montana Furniture is an expert in creating playful spaces and the effect of colours in the interior. Since 1982, the family-owned Danish company has been bringing high-quality furniture, proud Danish traditions, and a multitude of colours to private homes, public spaces and corporate facilities all over the world. At its factory in Denmark, Montana manufactures its own series of flexible, EU Eco-labelled, modular systems in a wide range of inspiring, playful colours. The collection also comprises reproductions of fine Danish design icons from Arne Jacobsen, Verner Panton, and Jørgen Rasmussen together with new and innovative designs by Jens Martin Skibsted, Anders Engholm and Kasper Mose.

artists.name: Audo Copenhagen
artists.description: Founded 105 years ago, TONI Copenhagen emerged from a family's deep-rooted appreciation for traditional brass finishing and craftsmanship. Across generations, dedicated professionals have upheld this craft. In 2024, TONI Copenhagen continues to embrace these enduring values. They advocate for a simplified and personalised world, encouraging thoughtful and lasting choices for home acquisitions. Committed to creating high-quality, enduring designs, TONI Copenhagen strives to produce timeless pieces that defy fleeting trends. Objects of lasting design carry inherent stories, providing a backdrop for life's everyday moments. This has been their trade since 1918.

artists.name: Stilling
artists.description: Stilling is a renowned design company that creates stunning, handcrafted curtain tracks for projects and exhibitions worldwide. Utilising a wide array of colours and shapes, Stilling facilitates the creation of creative architectural spaces. The legacy of Stilling began in 1949 when the founder, Preben Stilling, crafted his first window blind. Originating from the family basement, he sold the blind in his spare time, marking the beginning of decades of craftsmanship traditions on Danish soil. Stilling pioneers the use of recycled materials for drapery hardware and produces many of its beloved curtain tracks from a minimum of 75% recycled post-consumer materials.

artists.name: NTK Atelier
artists.description: NTK Atelier and NTK Retail & Contract are both brands of Englund-Gruppen – a well renowned company within the flooring industry with a successful history going back to 1986. The state-of-the-art production of custom-made hand-crafted rugs is strategically located in Mölndal, just outside Gothenburg (SE). Centrally situated showrooms can be found in both Gothenburg and Stockholm. With a solution-oriented approach and excellent service Englund-Gruppen has gradually grown from a local supplier to a company with clients worldwide. All products are characterised by high and consistent quality. The team of employees have a high level of knowledge and with sustainability as a cornerstone the customers are serviced.

artists.name: Johanson Design
artists.description: Johanson has captivated an international audience with its distinctive Scandinavian design. The brand's production of high recognised high value, emphases their commitment to offering premium furniture made in Sweden. The flexible manufacturing approach, allows for a tailor-made collection where customers can choose from 400 RAL colours and over 100 textile and leather coverings. Collaborating with some of Europe's finest designers, Johanson remains dedicated to pushing boundaries in product development, exploring innovative forms, materials, and technology. The current product range encompasses furniture, sound absorbers, and lamps.

artists.name: OPENHOUSE
artists.description: Openhouse Studio leads creative projects and bears brands' messages in a comprehensive and unique way. The studio offers an array of opportunities that can be customized to every brand-specific needs through developing events and building individual brand identities using creative direction, photography, videography, graphic design, and copywriting, among others. The studio emerged from Openhouse Magazine, a biannual publication that talks about art, design, architecture and culture, which also serves as a platform to engage with an international professional audience.

artists.name: Tarkett
artists.description: OWith a history of 140 years, Tarkett is a global leader in flooring and sports surfaces, committed to Human-Conscious Design®: standing with present and future generations and creating products and services that are good for people and for the planet. Tarkett believes in The Beauty of Circularity: achieving this through continual innovation in design and manufacturing and working with their customers to create more sustainable and healthier workplaces for humans and the environment. The Beauty of Circularity is about the implementation of innovative DESIGN and manufacturing, the beauty of the reused MATERIALS within their products, and taking responsibility for the full CIRCULAR JOURNEY of every material they work with.

artists.name: Glimakra of Sweden
artists.description: OThe Home of Acoustic Design – Glimakra of Sweden takes great pride in collaborating with local suppliers, always with immediate access to the renewable resources of the forest. Long-term focus on design, quality, and a responsible production has been acknowledged through several international design awards, and as Glimakra of Sweden moves into a circular future and continues to create products that stand the test of time – over and over again.

artists.name: Mari Koppanen
artists.description: OMari Koppanen stands at the forefront of contemporary design, operating at the intersections of design, material innovation, and artistic inquiry. Through raw material production and strong visual storytelling, the studio shapes the boundaries of future furniture design and material possibilities. Each piece emerges as a testament to the pursuit of novelty, where form seamlessly intertwines with function, sustainability, and social consciousness. Established by Finnish designer and Ph.D. Research Candidate Mari Koppanen, the studio specializes in crafting objects with a particular focus on the potential of materials and pigments derived from fungi and other micro-organisms.

artists.name: BOMMA
artists.description: BOMMA is a progressive Czech glass company, manufacturing handcrafted sculptural lighting. Their products transform interiors, creating a distinct mood in each space – from eye-catching centerpieces and installations to soft ambient light. BOMMA’s glassworks foster traditional craft in a technologically-advanced facility, enabling the production of exceptionally demanding pieces. The brand is renowned for its signature designs, bringing a sense of grace and delight. This minimalist, yet daring, aesthetic is appreciated by international architects and interior designers and has quickly gained recognition within the design world.

artists.name: Abstracta Interiør
artists.description: Abstracta have been working to create better soundscapes since 1972 – which makes them acoustics pioneers. Today, the brand offers a wide variety of solutions for different types of environments and requirements – from thoughtfully designed sound-absorbent screens and surfaces to innovative furniture with integrated acoustic characteristics. And in close collaboration with some of the world’s most influential contemporary designers, Abstracta is constantly exploring new ways to create better soundscapes. Abstracta manufacture the products in Småland, Sweden, and the customers are located throughout the world. Abstracta is part of Lammhults Design Group.

artists.name: FDB Møbler
artists.description: Furniture ought to make room for people. That has been the philosophy since 1942, when FDB Møbler was founded, with architect Børge Mogensen heading up the studio. Many new designers have since entered the fold, but the foundational principles remain the same: To create beautiful, functional and exceptionally crafted furniture that makes room for everyday living at home. FDB Møbler is internationally known as a frontrunner of Danish design. It’s a story of classic pieces to be passed down from generation to generation. Regardless of whether they are talking about iconic pieces or new, innovative designs, the goal is the same: To have the veritable quality of life that was envisioned when the first pieces of furniture emerged in 1942.

artists.name: Martela
artists.description: Martela - Best Workplaces is one of the leading Danish project houses with a long experience in completing activity-based, hybrid working and traditional workplace projects and servicing larger nation-wide private companies in creating best workplaces. The company works in close collaboration with customers, architects and suppliers with a broad know-how approach and the motto don't tell me, show me.

artists.name: Stolab Möbel
artists.description: Stolab strives to produce solid wood furniture with soul and character. The focus is on crafting furniture that is truly contemporary yet timeless, where the quality, design, and function contribute to its enduring beauty over time. Stolab aims to create pieces that can be enjoyed and appreciated by generations to come.

artists.name: Ragnars Inredningar
artists.description: ARagnars is a Swedish furniture company based in Småland, that specializes on high-end office furniture for the contemporary workplace. With their unique design, premium selection of materials and user-friendly functions, they strive to create furniture that contribute to a creative, healthy, and harmonious work environment.

artists.name: Astep
artists.description: Astep is a young, contemporary design company with a rich legacy. Founded in 2014 by Alessandro Sarfatti with the vision of creating and curating timeless design objects with an innovative approach and environmental awareness. Astep offers thoughtful, long-lasting and carefully crafted lighting for home interiors, offices and design spaces alike. Based in Copenhagen and produced in Italy, Astep draws heavily on the Italian design legacy of the Sarfatti family and continuously strive to remain curious and evolving.

artists.name: Illums Bolighus
artists.description: Illums Bolighus seamlessly blends the past and present, presenting a curated selection of timeless classics and innovative designs from the modern design scene. The store features an extensive range of top-quality products from Scandinavian and international design brands. A visit to Illums Bolighus promises an aesthetic journey of the senses, with meticulous attention to details and creative exhibitions that inspire ideas for enhancing your own living space.

artists.name: The Poster Club
artists.description: The Poster Club is a Copenhagen-based art platform offering, a carefully curated collection of premium art prints, made by individual artists from around the world. At the intersection of artistic expression and contemporary aesthetics, The Poster Club represents a rich diversity of artistic voices, making its global community a unique destination for those who seek inspiration or look for affordable art. The collection reflects the ever-evolving tapestry of life – spanning from abstract art, subtle illustrations, and bold graphics over eclectic photo art, ensuring that every wall becomes a canvas for both creativity and bliss.

artists.name: New Works
artists.description: New Works presents a collection at the intersection between old and new. Light and dark. Design and art. The collection pays homage to the strong Scandinavian history of craftsmanship and materiality, whilst challenging the contemporary forms of today. New Works collaborate with an international group of renowned designers and artisans, who display a matching fascination with sculptural forms and honest materials. These collaborative pursuits convey a love of the sensual, and of the bold.

artists.name: Innovation Living
artists.description: Innovation Living is a Danish sofa bed specialist. It is guided by the principle that the integration of form and function is essential for creating innovative, durable designs for everyday use. Since 1989, Innovation Living has focused on designing and developing multifunctional sofa beds. Today, the company is an internationally acclaimed sofa bed specialist. Tenksom, an emerging Danish furniture brand, based on an ambition to make durable design that reduces resource consumption and pollution. To prioritise sustainability, their products are designed for longevity, easy disassembly and recycling, expressing the ambition to create timeless, valuable designs for generations.

artists.name: KOYORI
artists.description: KOYORI is a modern design brand that embodies the distinct sense of Japanese aesthetics. Offering quality furniture and interior design that adds value to everyday life, KOYORI was founded to showcase the heritage of Japanese craftsmanship to the world. KOYORI products are crafted to be cherished for generations and to bestow happiness on their owners. This year marks the brand's second appearance at 3daysofdesign, following a successful launch exhibition in Milan in 2022.

artists.name: Normann Copenhagen
artists.description: Since Normann Copenhagen’s foundation in 1999, the brand's ambition has been to challenge conventional thinking and make the ordinary extraordinary through great design. By combining the craftsmanship, functionality and endurance characterized by its Danish design heritage with modern silhouettes and durable materials, Normann Copenhagen aims to create original products in a contemporary design that withstand the test of time. Normann Copenhagen believes in uniting people and spaces across the world and improving the quality of people’s lives through the power of great design. The brand's products combine functionality and design and accommodate the diversity of needs of modern life in residential and professional interiors alike.

artists.name: KETTAL
artists.description: Kettal is a specialized outdoor furniture designer and manufacturer. Since its beginnings in 1966, Kettal has had an international calling to design and innovation. Founded in Barcelona by Mr. Manuel Alorda, Kettal aspires to the joy of outdoor life. Today Kettal is managed by the second generation. In the first years of the 21st century, the brands Hugonet y Triconfort joined the Kettal group. Kettal works with the most important names in the international design scene who collectively have contributed to what is a well rounded, innovative and unique collection.

artists.name: TreCe
artists.description: TreCe is one of the leading Nordic suppliers of storage and recycling furniture. TreCe has reached this position by developing continuously. With over forty years of experience TreCe has together with their customers managed to collect a lot of knowledge, and through the years learned what works. TreCe´s experience along with a strong desire for innovation drives them forward and makes it possible to continually develop new smart design solutions.

artists.name: PLEASE WAIT to be SEATED
artists.description: PLEASE WAIT to be SEATED introduces contemporary designs with the potential to become classics. Prior to launching a new design, the brand consistently asks whether it will evolve into a long-lasting object worthy of being passed down through generations. The design collection possesses distinct characteristics, emphasizing basic graphic shapes, superior craftsmanship, and sustainability in both production methods and enduring design. The brand expresses gratitude for the international attention received and eagerly anticipates welcoming visitors to Copenhagen in June.

artists.name: Fritz Hansen
artists.description: Founded in Denmark in 1872, Fritz Hansen is a global leader in indoor and outdoor furniture, lighting, accessory design and production. Driven by a passion for beauty, quality, craftsmanship, and responsible manufacturing, the company embodies a modern Nordic lifestyle and collaborates with visionary artists, designers, and architects from around the world. The brand has worked with Arne Jacobsen, Cecilie Manz, Hans J. Wegner, Piero Lissoni, Jaime Hayon and Poul Kjærholm, among others. Today Fritz Hansen designs are sold in more than 85 countries through 2,000 points of sale, including flagship stores and showrooms in Copenhagen, New York, London, Seoul, Shanghai, Munich, and Tokyo. The company's HQ is based north of Copenhagen.

artists.name: NOMAD
artists.description: SNOMAD believes in innovation, in pushing boundaries and redefining the image of re- and upcycling in the interior industry. Their goal is to create design products with a special feel, a unique look and a meaningful story. NOMAD proves that upcycling can be tasteful and desirable and, most importantly, shape our daily lives and push global change forward. NOMAD creates interior products that tell stories of forgotten wonders and bring a magical new energy into homes, boutique hotels, restaurants, offices and even galleries and other locations where people come together to enjoy and to create. NOMAD carpets create a new standard of design for conscious consumers and open a new perspective on the aesthetic of recycled materials.

artists.name: &Tradition
artists.description: Founded in 2010 in Copenhagen, &Tradition is an international brand, built on a Danish legacy of craftmanship and design. &Tradition tell stories with originality. Whether the starting point is new or re-issued, they are passionate about designing the classics of tomorrow. They believe in empowering their employees and network of creatives, designers and partners to take an active part in their journey as a brand.

artists.name: Fontein & Bova
artists.description: Fontein & Bova is a young, small-scale Belgian company with big dreams, specializing in the design and crafting of distinctive, solid wood designer furniture with great respect for craftsmanship and an eye for detail. All our pieces are entirely handmade in Belgium (Wichelen) by our small team of craftspeople with a tremendous passion for the material and the craft. High-quality hardwood such as oak and walnut are consistently used to achieve the most sustainable and high end result possible. Our partners, including those providing fabrics used in our upholstery, are carefully selected to ensure a reliable, 100% Belgian quality label.

artists.name: UMAGE
artists.description: UMAGE is a Danish word meaning ‘making an effort’, and that’s what they aim to do every day. UMAGE is where beautiful Danish design meets affordability, high-quality materials and a genuine care for the environment. UMAGE combine aesthetics, simplicity and functionality and infuse it with thoughtful craftsmanship and environmental care. The result is exquisite furniture and lighting designs with a sustainable edge.

artists.name: House of Finn Juhl
artists.description: For over two decades, House of Finn Juhl, Onecollection, has been entrusted with the exclusive rights to revive and manufacture Finn Juhl’s iconic furniture. Made with respect for the original heritage and an undying commitment to quality and durability, the collection now features more than 50 classic masterpieces. Each piece is expertly crafted using only the finest materials in the hands of dedicated and skilled craftspeople, ensuring a quality that lasts for generations.

artists.name: Simonsen and Czechura
artists.description: Founded in 1994 in Copenhagen, Simonsen og Czechura is a company with many years of experience in building and designing kitchens and furniture. Today their range includes design of complete interiors in beautiful houses throughout Europe. Their knowledge of craftsmanship allows them to build and implement a wide range of design solutions for their clients. Simonsen and Czechura approaches functionality through the eyes of Scandinavian simplicity. While their signature style is considered Scandinavian and contemporary, they also strive to integrate a myriad of styles and materials from around the globe. They offer design solutions that will work with your style and sense of aesthetic, designed to last a lifetime.

artists.name: Mindo
artists.description: Mindo is a Danish-based outdoor furniture brand with a sustainable perspective on outdoor living. With a strong focus on design and materials, Mindo offers high-quality outdoor furniture without compromising on aesthetics or comfort. Working with renowned European designers and carefully selected recyclable materials from industry-leading manufacturers, the Mindo mindset has always been about awareness of the environment and taking responsibility for the resources used. The collection is created for gardens, terraces, and urban spaces. For dining and for lounging. For families, for friends, or time alone. Mindo is made for moments.

artists.name: Porcelanosa
artists.description: Combining Spanish heritage with modern design, Porcelanosa redefines the home with timeless elegance. Known worldwide for its premium ceramic tiles, bathroom accessories, and kitchen solutions, Porcelanosa creates inspirational living spaces, inviting you to create unforgettable moments. The brand perfectly blends tradition and contemporary style, creating a distinctive and sustainable signature for homes that stand the test of time.

artists.name: Eilersen
artists.description: “From coach to couch” – Founded in 1895, Eilersen has focused on craftsmanship, quality, and innovation. The journey began producing coaches, and since the 1930s, Eilersen has been making beautiful, high-quality couches based on the same traditional values of excellent craftsmanship and innovation that founded the company almost 130 years ago. This has made Eilersen a well-known and recognised high-end brand internationally.

artists.name: Cosentino
artists.description: Cosentino is a global manufacturer of sustainable surfaces for architecture, design and interior – and presents the 2024 launches of their two main brands, Dekton and Silestone. Inspired by natural stone, craftmanship and recycling and produced with renewable energy, the versatile, carbon-neutral collections meet current trends – and the creativity of architects and interior designers world wide. Cosentino will present the versatile technical, ultracompact stone and hybrid surfaces as part of a curated exhibition to inspire through innovative and sustainable spaces as architectural facades, wall claddings, countertops and interior design.

artists.name: Louis Poulsen
artists.description: Founded in 1874, the Danish lighting manufacturer Louis Poulsen creates products that encompass the duality of design and light. Every detail in the design has a purpose. Every design starts and ends with light. Louis Poulsen offers a range of lighting aimed at the commercial and domestic lighting markets, with illumination and solutions for both indoor and outdoor applications. In close partnership with designers, architects and other talents like Poul Henningsen, Arne Jacobsen, Verner Panton, Øivind Slaatto, Alfred Homann, Louise Campbell and Oki Sato, Louis Poulsen has established itself as one of the key global suppliers of architectural and decorative lighting and has a global presence with showrooms world wide.

artists.name: DCWéditions
artists.description: DCWéditions creates lighting objects that are thoughtfully conceived, well designed and well made. Whether they are re-editions of classics like La Lampe Gras or new contemporary designs, the pieces are rooted in the past, live in the present with a deep understanding of the future. They bring people together, making any space feel like home. Even a hotel corridor. Companions for living well, they’re meant to endure over time and be passed down from generation to generation. Because edition is, above all, a human affair. For those who love to touch the light, welcome home.

artists.name: Designmuseum Denmark
artists.description: Located in the heart of central Copenhagen, Designmuseum Danmark is Denmark's leading museum of Danish and international design. The museum shows up to eight exhibitions about design history, contemporary design, the design of the future, as well as Danish design icons by Verner Panton, Finn Juhl, Arne Jacobsen and more. The museum communicates quality and craftsmanship, ideas and processes, and breakthroughs within design through its exhibitions, events, and learning activities. Designmuseum Danmark reopened in June 2022 after two years of renovations. Guests can now visit the new museum café for coffee, lunch or dinner, the new museum shop and the museum garden, which is a quiet, green oasis in the middle of the city.

artists.name: +Halle
artists.description: +Halle® exists to develop a different type of furniture, designed to make a difference to people’s daily lives, helping them focus, work, and relax in ways they actually want. Furniture shaped by human behaviour is furniture shaped by those who use it. The more minds involved, the more evolved the design. +Halle® is where the conversation begins.

artists.name: Massproductions
artists.description: In 2009 two designers, sharing a neo-modernist vision of functional, elegant design, decided to break free of PR-driven product strategies to create a furniture company focusing on the interplay between object and context. In order to realise their vision, they assumed control of the entire production chain – manufacturing, sales and marketing. This pioneering approach has paid off handsomely, not only in design clarity, but also in distinguished awards, renowned clients and representation in the permanent collection of the Swedish National Museum of Arts.

artists.name: Brdr. Krüger
artists.description: Established in 1886, Brdr. Krüger spans five generations of quality furniture craftsmanship in Denmark. Collaborating with today's talents in design and interior, the brand curates an evolving collection, merging classic Danish design with modernity. Over 137 years of craft and heritage, paired with modern techniques, shapes innovative designs with timeless appeal.

artists.name: Thorup Copenhagen
